Wow, I can't believe this has been cracked already - so fast. I actually bought this one in advance... I love PB games. 

The Skyrim vs Risen 2 arguments reminds me of the Oblivion vs Gothic 3 arguments from ages ago haha. 

This is good - these games need more fans to bring it into the light more.

I'm a huge PC RPG junkie. I've played just about every RPG made for the PC in the last 15 years. I really enjoyed Risen. Sometimes the little-known titles go underappreciated. Risen was a solid RPG. I've seen the Gothic series mentioned here. The first two Gothic editions were also superb. Risen reminds me of one of the best RPGs I've ever played - the extremely underrated Two World II.

I already bought Risen 2 because I have no doubt that I will enjoy it. I'm really looking forward to Two Worlds III. These are RPGs that put the fun back into RPG again. Support them!

@caszxc

TPB uses Magnet links, not torrent files. Magnet links contain a hash of the files included and use what is know as DHT to find the files and the people hosting them.

This means you have to start the torrent client downloading and just let it go for a while before it finds the people hosting the files and then queries them for the actual file information.

After that it writes the files out and starts really downloading. Check the following words in Wikipedia for details:
DHT
Magnet Link

Works perfect, shit game. Played for 15 mins & went to the recycle bin. Terrible UI, combat, quests, savepoints, completely boring talents, terrible voice acting. How this game got above 2/10 on all reviews is beyond me.

Installed and working, just like all games I've downloaded from SKIDROW. Don't listen do those above me, the game is great. You can't judge a game by playing 15 minutes. Especially not quests. Lol. If you want a good RPG with pirate-theme, then download this. Or better yet, buy it. Some bugs here and there, but name a game that's completely bug-free at launch. A couple patches and it will be one of the better games 2012. Voice actors are great. Especially the protagonist. So far, 3-4 hours into the game, I would give it 7 or perhaps 8 of 10. There will always be people complaining. Download and judge for yourself.

@NonyxGel

I completely agree with you. Both Risen 1 and Two Worlds 2 are really great games. Risen 2 too. I'm also sure you will enjoy it!

KEEP REPOSTING THIS COMMENT SO PEOPLE CAN GET THIS GAME WORKING ON THEIR PC!



------------ nVidia fixes -----------

If you start the game and hear the audio but do not see the game, uninstall / reinstall physX!

---------------------------------------

If you start the game and it runs INCREDIBLY slow on the main menu, uninstall your graphics drivers and reinstall the NEWEST nVidia drivers from the nVidia website!

---------------------------------------

If you run the game and it runs fine for a few minutes but then starts to run EXTREMELY slowly @ 5-15 FPS, uninstall nVidia 3D Vision Driver! It is a seperate driver from your actual graphics card driver, so do not be afraid to remove it!




KEEP REPOSTING SO PEOPLE CAN GET THIS GAME WORKING!

FOR PEOPLE WHO CANNOT LAUNCH!  (i.e. Blank screen for a second and then desktop)

1.  If you have 7.1 sound, set this to 5.1 (via control panel/sound/speakers/configure).  This gets the game running.

2.  If you have 2+ monitors, make sure ONLY 1 is active!

3.  Sorry if above does not sort your problem - but please state if it does.

4.  Shoot the programmers for the hashed release.

source:  http://forums.steampowered.com/forums/showthread.php?t=2566209

Got to say, I've been playing this for around 20 hours or so now and I love it!  Each to there own I guess - there is a lot of faffing around and talking, but some genuinely cool moments (and I like the combat too).  I think a lot of people have been too harsh on this, as I think it's fixed a lot of 'Risen 1's problems.  Shame about the character graphics, but everything else looks great.  I'll be buying this, and hoping they add more PC specific improvements later.  (p.s. if you possess the commandant, it's quite a laugh giving Patty a hard time before you steal the ship)

If anyone uses xfire and would like it to be detected, you need to go to Control Panel-Folder Options-View-Show hidden files and folders.
Then navigate to C:Program DateXfirexfire games.ini and open it with notepad.
Ctrl+F to search for Risen 2
Then insert this code after the numbers in square brackets:
LongName=Risen 2: Dark Waters
ShortName=rsn2
LauncherDirKey=HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINESOFTWAREDEEP SILVERSYSTEM
LauncherExe=Risen2.exe
DetectExe=Risen2.exe
Launch=%UA_LAUNCHER_EXE_PATH% -applaunch 40390 %UA_LAUNCHER_EXTRA_ARGS% %UA_LAUNCHER_NETWORK_ARGS%
InGameRenderer=D3D9
InGameFlags=USE_PRESENT|ENABLE_MOUSE|NEW_INPUT_SYSTEM|DISABLE_RELEASE

Tested and works.  Enjoy!

And it seems that TPB won't allow for backslash in the comments.  How lovely.  Well, you can figure it out if you have a decent knowledge of computers and how file detection works.  Unfortunately, there are no threads on Xfire forums regarding this issue.  But I'll see about starting one so if you can't figure out where the backslashes go in the detection code, you can find the code on their forums.
